body: r_c glares down at m_c with a scowl. How pathetic. To think this is {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mate. Hopefully, future ones won't be as disappointing as {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

With m_c gone from this world, r_c, to make {PRONOUN/r_c/self} not look daunting, dramatically woes {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with fake tears at the vigil. Hopefully, with the right amount of tears, a more preferable cat will be betrothed to {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

Driven by empathy and sorrow, Clanmates reach out to r_c, offering prey and a noble shoulder to cry on after the vigil for m_c. However, r_c simply turns down every gesture of sympathy; death comes for everyone, and it took its sweet time for m_c.

r_c holds m_c in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} paws during the vigil, weeping burning tears onto the cold, limp body. Even if things have soured throughout their lives, and r_c wants nothing more but to hiss at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} dumb mate, deep down, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} misses m_c.

Near the end of m_c's vigil, Clanmates' eyes shift towards r_c, moving aside for the widow to say {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} farewells. However, unlike what is expected, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} twists {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} head solemnly, and, with an icy voice, states that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} has nothing to say about {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mate.

At the end of the vigil, after the tears are shed and the mourning sweeps through the Clan, r_c drags {PRONOUN/r_c/self} straight into {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nest. m_c and r_c once share this nest, but now it's all {PRONOUN/r_c/poss}. Despite only resurfacing horrible memories between the two, the nest feels... empty.

{PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} doesn't care what {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates say about how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should behave during m_c's vigil. Tears are meant for those {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} cares about, but m_c will never receive a single drop from {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.
no_body: As the days fade, it doesn't take much for r_c to notice the sudden disappearance of m_c. {PRONOUN/m_c/poss/CAP} disappearance is like a StarClan's blessing. Thus, r_c won't squander this opportunity to savor the long-desired taste of freedom without {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mate breathing down {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} neck. And, with no body found to hold a vigil, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} doesn't need to weep, only to celebrate.
